alert.note: Alert for Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued December 12 at 12:02PM PST until December 14 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Watch, temperatures in the lower 30s possible. For the second Freeze Watch, temperatures in the lower 30s possible. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley, Kofa, Central La Paz County, Gila River Valley, Tonopah Desert, Northwest Pinal County, Tonto Basin and Dripping Springs. In California, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Watch, from late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from late Wednesday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
